Australia: The Labor government falls and Joseph Lyons becomes Prime Minister
Brazil: The Justiça Eleitoral do Brasil is created by Decreto nº 21.076;
Women win the right to vote.
Peter Fleming joins the expedition to find missing Englishman Colonel Percy Fawcett; the following year he publishes an account of the expedition, entitled Brazilian Adventure.
Four protesting students (Martins, Miragaia, Dráusio and Camargo) are killed by government troops, sparking off the "Paulista War".
Paulista rebels take control of the state of São Paulo.
Constitutionalist Revolution: The population of the state of São Paulo revolt against the 1930 coup d'état.
The São Paulo rebels are defeated by government forces.
Brazilian Integralism, a Fascist movement, is founded by Plínio Salgado.
Chile: The period of political anarchy ends with the return to power of Arturo Alessandri Palma.
China: Lin Sen became chairman of the Nationalist government.

January 28 Incident: Japanese aircraft carriers began bombing Shanghai in a series of raids which would kill some four thousand soldiers of the 19th Route Army and as many as twenty thousand Chinese civilians.
Defense of Harbin: Japanese bombs and artillery forced the Jilin Self-Defence Army to retreat from Harbin.
The independent state of Manchukuo was established on the territory of Japanese-occupied Manchuria.
Pacification of Manchukuo: The Big Swords Society rebelled en masse against the government of Manchukuo.
Cyprus: Sir Reginald Edward Stubbs became governor.
France: Albert Lebrun began his term as president of France.
Japan: Manchukuo, the puppet state of Japan, is established
Philippine: George C. Butte appointed as acting Civil Governor (1932)
Theodore Roosevelt, Jr. appointed as Civil Governor (1932–1933)
Adamson School of Industrial Chemistry (ASIC) later known as Adamson University was founded by George Lucas Adamson
Radio station KZEG begins operation, sister station of KZRM; call sign later changed to KZRF.
The Communist Party of the Philippines is declared illegal by the Supreme Court
Poland: Signing of the Soviet–Polish Non-Aggression Pact
Russia: The Karakalpak Autonomous Oblast became the Karakalpak ASSR.

Collectivisation in the USSR: The Central Executive Committee and the Sovnarkom issued the Decree about the Protection of Socialist Property, under which any theft of public property was punishable by death.
Holodomor: Stalin sent a letter to a Politburo ally, Lazar Kaganovich, demanding the subjection of the Ukrainian SSR.
A decree by the Central Executive Committee and the Sovnarkom established a passport system in the Soviet Union.
First Five-Year Plan: It was announced that the plan had been fulfilled.
Singapore: Tanjong Pagar Railway Station is opened.
USA: The Reconstruction Finance Corporation was established.
The Norris–La Guardia Act was signed into law.
The Bonus Army protests began in Washington, D.C.
Amelia Earhart flew solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
United States presidential election, 1932: New York Governor Franklin Delano Roosevelt is elected President, defeating incumbent Herbert Hoover.
